required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dexmedetomidine on Segmental EEG Power Spectra
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Dexmedetomidine on Segmental EEG Power Spectra Activity Under Propofol-based Anesthesia

collaborator.agency: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the EEG power spectra activity during propofol-based anesthesia in the presence or absence of dexmedetomidine in patients undergoing hysteroscopic examination and surgery to determine whether the addition of dexmedetomidine will induce better sleep-like anesthesia status.

detailed_description.textblock:
Three groups of patients undergoing hysteroscopic examination and surgery will be studied: 1) control group, patients will receive propofol intravenous infusion to provide anesthesia; 2) dexmedetomidine 0.5 microgram/kg group. This dexmedetomidine dose is infused within 10 min and then the use of propofol for anesthesia; and 3) dexmedetomidine 1 microgram/kg group. This dexmedetomidine dose is infused within 10 min and then the use of propofol for anesthesia.
Each group will have 20 patients.
General conditions including blood pressure, respiration, and heart rates will be recorded.
EEG power spectra activity will be recorded no-invasively by a Narcotrend EEG monitor.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From prior to anesthesia to 10 min after anesthesia.
primary_outcome.description: EEG power spectra monitored no-invasively by Narcotrend

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From prior to anesthesia to 10 min after anesthesia.
From prior to anesthesia to 10 min after anesthesia.
From prior to anesthesia to 10 min after anesthesia.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive intravenous propofol infusion.
Patients will receive dexmedetomidine 0.5 microgram/kg and then intravenous propofol infusion.
Patients will receive dexmedetomidine 1 microgram/kg and then intravenous propofol infusion.

study_pop.textblock: patients for hysteroscopic examination and surgery under general anesthesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical status I to II grade.
- body mass index 18 to 25 kg/m2
- no vision or hearing impairment
- will receive general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- with psychological or mental diseases
- with neurological diseases
- treating with steroids or with alcohol dependence.

eligibility.gender_description: Patients undergoing hysteroscopic examination and surgery.
